item.content:encoded:
Wondering what’s going on at Walt Disney World?  Look no further!  Here is a list of current and upcoming events!
NOW-
Symphony in the Stars: A Galactic Spectacular Nightly Fireworks at Disney’s Hollywood Studios
March 1st-April 2nd: Atlanta Braves Spring Training @ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex
March 2nd-May 30th: EPCOT International Flower & Garden Festival
Spring 2016: Rivers of Light at Disney’s Animal Kingdom park
Summer 2016: Frozen Character Greeting and Frozen Ever After Attraction at Epcot!

Ready to book your trip? Contact me today!

item.title: The mystery of the Hidden Mickey
item.description: Have you ever spotted a what you thought was a Mickey Mouse symbol at one of the parks or resorts?  It may have been!  There are “Hidden Mickeys” throughout the parks and resorts that Imagineers  have crafted into their designs.   The first published sighting of a Hidden Mickey was by Arlen Miller who wrote an article on them for Walt Disney World’s “Eyes and Ears” (a Cast Member weekly publication) in 1989.   It actually sta [...]
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever spotted a what you thought was a Mickey Mouse symbol at one of the parks or resorts?  It may have been!  There are “Hidden Mickeys” throughout the parks and resorts that Imagineers  have crafted into their designs.   The first published sighting of a Hidden Mickey was by Arlen Miller who wrote an article on them for Walt Disney World’s “Eyes and Ears” (a Cast Member weekly publication) in 1989.  
 
It actually started out as an inside joke among the Imagineers and has become a park tradition.  In the late 1970’s and early 1980”s because the Disney Company had decided that EPCOT Center would be a more adult park which included selling alcohol.  Disney characters and alcohol was deemed an improper combination and it was decided that none of the characters including Mickey Mouse would be seen at EPCOT Center. This became a challenge to the Imagineers and they started including hidden Mickey Mouse profiles in various different elements of the park.  As the park grew guest comments let Disney to include characters in EPCOT Center but the tradition of the Hidden Mickeys was already born and has become a staple in all of the theme park designs since. So on your next visit, see how many Hidden Mickeys you can find!
 
Fun facs-
 
 Disney Management has yet to officially acknowledge the existence of the Hidden Mickey. 
 
A true Hidden Mickey is one that is not meant to be seen immediately.  It is usually purposefully placed by a Disney Imagineer or artist in a context that wouldn’t normally contain Mickey Mouse.
 
No one knows exactly how many Hidden Mickeys there are as attractions are closed, refurbished or replaced by new ones.

 
Have you ever searched for Hidden Mickeys?  How many did you find?  You can check out HiddenMickeyGuy.com to see the locations of some!

item.title: Dinner is served
item.description: One of my most favorite restaurants at Walt Disney World is the Whispering Canyon Cafe located at The Wilderness Lodge.  It's a themed restaraunt that is A LOT of fun! Especially if you have kids! The best part is, the food is really great too! You've got a couple of options... to "Jump in and play" or to "Watch from the fence."   If you choose to "Jump in and play" you'll enjoy a sometimes sarcastic server who will keep the laughs coming through out dinner.  We find it d [...]
item.content:encoded:
One of my most favorite restaurants at Walt Disney World is the Whispering Canyon Cafe located at The Wilderness Lodge.  It's a themed restaraunt that is A LOT of fun! Especially if you have kids! The best part is, the food is really great too!
You've got a couple of options... to "Jump in and play" or to "Watch from the fence."   If you choose to "Jump in and play" you'll enjoy a sometimes sarcastic server who will keep the laughs coming through out dinner.  

We find it difficult sometimes with a 2 year old and 4 year old to have a sit down dinner. They get bored and can sometimes be loud which I know affects the person next to us so we try and be courteous.  The Whispering Canyon Cafe has a bit of a rowdy environment so it isn't a big deal.  At one point when we first sat down my two year old didn't want to be in a high chair so he was whining/crying and the server looks over from the table next to us and says "Now stop that! Nobody wants to hear that! You are at the happiest place on earth!!"  Shocked, he just looked at her and stopped.  It was hilarious. 

The food....  The most popular menu item and the one that we've enjoyed on our visits is the "All you care to enjoy skillet" it starts you off 
 with Family-style Mixed Greens tossed in an Apple Vinaigrette Dressing and Fresh-baked Cornbread. Then comes the  Slow-smoked Pork Ribs, Barbecued Pulled Pork, Roasted Chicken, Oak-roasted Beef Strip Loin, and Western-style Sausage served with Seasonal Farm Fresh Vegetables, Mashed Yukon Potatoes, Corn on the Cobb, and Cowboy-style Baked Beans. 

The great thing about this all you can eat skillet, is it's not your traditional buffet style.  They bring you a skillet for your table filled with the food and then as you want more they bring it to you.   It's $29.99 for an adult and $11.99 for kids, but it's well worth it!  It's some of the best BBQ I've ever had (and being from the South I've had a lot!).  Another fun feature is that you can get milkshakes with dinner and the refills are unlimited!   While this was very exciting to my four year old, she only got half way through one milkshake :). 

To go along with the sassy fun natured wait staff, there is also hobby horse riding, and napkin twirling to add to a rowdy night's dinner.   It's definitely worth checking out and a nice break from the parks.    Reservations are recommended or show up right when they open at 5:00.  They fill up fast and I saw them turning away multiple people. 

Oh... one last thing, on your visit, don't forget to ask for ketchup!

item.title: Christmas Lights!!
item.description: This past weekend we went down to Disney to check out the Osbourne Family Lights at Hollywood Studios.  Can I just say...Amazing!?  It was beautiful and if you haven't experienced it yet I highly recommend it, especially since this is the last year. ​ There's music, dancing lights and even some snow! The kids had an absolute blast as did we!​ [...]
item.content:encoded:
This past weekend we went down to Disney to check out the Osbourne Family Lights at Hollywood Studios.  Can I just say...Amazing!?  It was beautiful and if you haven't experienced it yet I highly recommend it, especially since this is the last year. 

​
There's music, dancing lights and even some snow! The kids had an absolute blast as did we!
​

item.title: Walt Disney World Resorts- Port Orleans
item.description: Port Orleans Riverside is one of my favorite Walt Disney World Resorts to stay at.  It makes you feel as though you've traveled to the movie version of New Orleans.   Port Orleans Riverside and the French Quarter take all of the amazing aspects of the south and New Orleans and bring it to Orlando.   My favorite room to stay in is the Royal Guest Room.  When booking this room your experience begins at check in with a royal proclamation from Princess Tiana.  Once in t [...]
item.content:encoded:
Port Orleans Riverside is one of my favorite Walt Disney World Resorts to stay at.  It makes you feel as though you've traveled to the movie version of New Orleans.   Port Orleans Riverside and the French Quarter take all of the amazing aspects of the south and New Orleans and bring it to Orlando.   
My favorite room to stay in is the Royal Guest Room.  When booking this room your experience begins at check in with a royal proclamation from Princess Tiana.  Once in the room you will see the room decorated with photos of the Disney Princesses and silhouettes of Disney Princes.  It certainly lives up to the royal guest room expectations.   Then, there's the headboard.  The headboard is beautiful on it's own, but when you press the button on the side you get a fireworks display! 
This is one of Disney's Moderate resorts and prices well within reason.  The scenery of the resort tells a story that makes your stay even more fun! And let's not forget about the beignets that are found at Port Orleans French Quarter! 

 Check out the video below!
